spatial_accuracy.notes: Major layout mismatches vs 2D plan. (E2) Kitchen is shown as an open integrated space into the living/dining in 3D, while the 2D plan has a clearly separated kitchen with a door and a dedicated utility. (E1) Utility room is not clearly present as a separate space. (E2/E3) Entrance location/orientation appears wrong: 2D entrance is centered along the bottom edge entering living/dining; 3D shows a primary exterior door on the right facade leading into the kitchen/dining zone. (E2) Toilet placements do not match: the 2D has multiple toilets including a powder/toilet near entrance and toilets near bedrooms; 3D shows fewer/relocated toilets and different adjacency. (E4) Corridor/wide-passage geometry and room proportions are not preserved; 3D compresses/reshapes the long linear plan into a more compact block. (E2) Balcony arrangement differs: 2D has 2 balconies (living/dining top-center and master on left); 3D shows prominent stacked left-side balconies and a rear balcony layout that does not clearly match the plan’s positions and access points. (E2) Window placement/count does not correspond to the 2D openings; several facade windows appear arbitrary relative to the plan.

structural_fidelity.notes: Adjacency and enclosure fidelity is weak. (E2) Kitchen–utility relationship is incorrect (utility missing/merged). (E1) Powder toilet (P.Toilet) near the entrance in the 2D plan is not represented as a distinct room in 3D. (E2) Bedroom/toilet adjacencies are inconsistent with the plan (toilets appear reduced and/or repositioned). (E5) Exterior massing/facade elements (multiple stacked balconies and extra window placements) introduce features not supported by the single-floor 2D plan. Wall thickness is visually consistent, but wall alignment and room boundary locations do not track the 2D plan.

furniture_mapping.notes: (E2) Furniture arrangement does not follow the 2D plan intent: living/dining and kitchen furniture are arranged as an open-plan composition rather than the 2D’s separated kitchen and central living/dining with balcony. (E4) Some furniture scaling/clearances (notably kitchen/dining zone) appear optimized for the 3D concept rather than matching the 2D room sizes and circulation widths.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Isometric presentation is strong with clean materials and readable spaces. Camera is broadly correct for an isometric-style view, though not orthographic-accurate (visible perspective). Lighting is pleasing and geometry is mostly clean, but the cutaway/void and facade detailing emphasize a different building concept than the 2D plan, reducing architectural clarity as a verification render.

detected_errors.description: Kitchen location/boundary incorrect: rendered as open to living/dining; 2D plan shows a separate enclosed kitchen with a door.
Utility room (adjacent to kitchen in 2D) missing as a clearly separated space in the 3D render.
Entrance placement incorrect: 2D entrance is bottom-center into living/dining; 3D shows primary entry on right facade leading into kitchen/dining zone.
Powder toilet (P.Toilet) near the entrance in the 2D plan is not represented as a distinct room in the 3D render.
Toilet count/locations do not match the 2D plan (multiple toilets in 2D appear reduced/relocated in 3D).
Overall plan proportions distorted: long linear unit with wide passages in 2D is compressed/reshaped in 3D.
Balcony configuration mismatch: 2D indicates two balconies (living/dining top-center and master left); 3D shows prominent stacked left balconies and unclear access alignment.
Window placement/count inconsistent with the 2D plan openings; several facade windows appear arbitrary relative to room positions.
Hallucinated exterior/facade elements (extra stacked balconies and window patterning) not supported by the single-floor 2D plan.
